thread.title: Exclusive: Denver Film Festival announces red carpet lineup details
thread.title_full: Exclusive: Denver Film Festival announces red carpet lineup details - The Denver Post

author: John Wenzel
title: Exclusive: Denver Film Festival announces red carpet lineup details
text:
The Denver Film Festival will host the Colorado premieres of writer-director Charlie Kaufman's latest work "Anomalisa," Todd Haynes' highly anticipated drama "Carol" and documentarian Michael Moore's "Where to Invade Next" as part of its 38th installment next month.
The festival, which shared those titles and others with The Denver Post this week, runs Nov. 4-15 at the Sie FilmCenter, but the aforementioned films are part of its red-carpet offerings at the Ellie Caulkins Opera House.
Kaufman's stop-motion animated comedy "Anomalisa" will serve as the festival's opening-night feature on Nov. 4, while its "centerpiece" presentation is Moore's "Where to Invade Next" (Nov. 6), followed by the event-closing "Coming Through the Rye," director James Sadwith's fictionalized account of one teenager's attempt to gain an audience with author J.D. Salinger (Nov. 14).
In addition to a Nov. 14 matinee screening of Haynes' "Carol," starring Cate Blanchett and Rooney Mara, the festival will also include special presentations of "The Boat Builder," "Brooklyn," "Hitchcock/Truffaut," "I Saw the Light," "The Lady in the Van," "Mia Madre," "My All American," "Son of Saul," "Suffragete" and "Youth."
